author: George Bellshaw
title: Thibaut Courtois believes Antonio Conte’s demanding nature has turned Chelsea into title contenders
text:
Conte has demanded a lot from his players this season? (Picture: Getty) Thibaut Courtois believes Antonio Conte’s demanding nature is the key behind Chelsea ’s success this season.
The Belgian goalkeeper has enjoyed the campaign under the Italian tactician, who sit nine points clear at the top of the Premier League table.
Arsenal star criticises Arsene Wenger's team selection vs Chelsea Chelsea put Arsenal to the sword 3-1 at Stamford Bridge at the weekend and firmly established themselves as the dominant side in England’s top flight.
With 14 games to go, Chelsea look set to lift the Premier League trophy come May and Courtois has picked out his manager’s demands as one of the main factors behind their title charge.
‘It’s good to have a manger who is demanding a lot,’ the 24-year-old told Sky Sports. 
‘You have to be at your top every week, and that’s what makes you champion.
The pair have struck up a good relationship (Picture: Getty) ‘If you have a manager who is not demanding then sometimes you relax and lose games.’
Courtois added that he’s aiming to improve his own game every day.
‘I want to improve myself to reach a higher level,’ he added.

‘I think I’m on a very good level, but I know that I can improve myself. I think in everything you can improve.
‘When I was in Belgium, I played a lot of ball short. At Atletico Madrid, the trainer preferred only long balls, so you forget to play short a little. So maybe it might be the biggest point of improvement.
‘Everything you can improve everyday and search for perfection and that’s what I’ll try to do.’
